fields.description:
It takes about 4.5 seconds usually.

It does about 461 property set SELECTs.

We should probably make this faster.
fields.summary: GHGoToBoard slow on JAC

fields.description:
If you are someone using a Kanban board to manage a support queue, you may need to move an issue from one person to another.

If you have a Kanban board that has assignee swim lanes, it would be nice if you could reassign an issue simply by moving the issue from one assignee swim lane to another assignee swim lane.
fields.summary: As a project manager with a Kanban board, I should be able to reassign an issue by moving the issue between assignee swim lanes

fields.description:
The format in which we are publishing Atlassian Analytics events is incorrect. Event parameters which are often long, user-specific strings, are being attached to the event name, which should stay constant.

[~jrotenstein] to provide examples in an attachment.
fields.summary: Atlassian Analytics events are being published incorrectly

fields.description:
Currently if a board has a huge list of Epics, there is no way to filter it down to a manageable.

This feature request is to add some sort of filtering option for Epics.
fields.summary: Add option to Filter Epics on Rapid Board

fields.description: For now, when closing a sprint, the not completed issues are moved to the backlog. It would be a great feature to be able to move those issues to another sprint when closing the sprint.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to move the not completed issues to the next sprint when closing a given sprint

fields.description:
According to our documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Creating+a+Sprint

{quote}
Your new 'upcoming' sprint will be added to your board, below any other future sprints. If you wish, you can edit the name, start date and end date.
{quote}

It turns out you cannot edit the start and end dates, only the name. When you start a sprint, then you can edit the start and end dates.

Thanks!
Clarissa.
fields.summary: Edit the documentation on Creating Sprints

fields.description:
It would be really nice to be able to "group" Quick Filters in the Rapid Board, creating some sort of dropdown. Best solution would be similar to the filtering implemented now in the JIRA Issue Navigator's simple search.

*Background:*
- when you have to filter for a lot of projects and more than 3 team members, it gets very messy and cluttered, especially on smaller screens (covered by GHS-9272);
- at the moment Quick Filters have to be modified every time there's a change in the team or project priorities.
fields.summary: Allow user to configure Quick Filters that provide dynamic filtering by value for a particular field

fields.description: In the future, when the project templates plugin supports a callback into the original page the user was on, with GreenHopper now enabled, we should redirect there and create the project they wanted, instead of to our own welcome mat.
fields.summary: Redirect user to project templates plugin after GH is installed

fields.description:
Proposed changes (via [~jrogers] )
* always show column counts based on select option for column tally unit - same as column constraint options without the none
* additional option in config to turn on column constraints, show/don't show

* effort required in JavaLand to pass the column counts to column when no constraints are in use
fields.summary: As a user I want to see the column tally without choosing column constraints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-8091].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
There is a new issue which has come up which affects all issue collectors being served from https://jira.atlassian.com. Current analysis is the following.
# User is logged in to https://support.atlassian.com or https://confluence.atlassian.com. This means that the new Unified Login for Atlassian (https://id.atlassian.com) knows the User.
# User has never accessed https://jira.atlassian.com after the unified login process was introduced.
# User opens *their JIRA instance* and accesses GreenHopper.
# GreenHopper throws up a red banner saying Syntax Error for the script feedback.js.

h3. Analysis
The feedback.js download request from GreenHopper goes to https://jira.atlassian.com and is intercepted by the Unified Login and taken to the 'Merge Accounts' page (so instead of the feedback.js the html content of the 'Merge Accounts' page is downloaded)

h3. Workaround
Access https://jira.atlassian.com and complete the 'Merge Accounts' process. Once done, do a hard refresh of the GreenHopper window (CMD/CTRL+SHIFT+R)
fields.summary: GreenHopper Feedback Errors With an Active Atlassian ID Session

fields.description: Check against JIRA 6.0-OD-10
fields.summary: Need to check 6.0 HTML escaping
Document for customers how to build GreenHopper from source

fields.description: The burndown gadget shows a "There are no active sprints" warning in case the selected sprint has been completed already. The days remaining does just shows 0 days.
fields.summary: Sprint is shown even if complete
ADG GH: NWD labels to AUI labels
align messages with burndown gadget - warning instead of error
Non working days not taken into account
wallboardification

fields.description: It would be great if we can have an option to edit the labels from GreenHopper, such as "Backlog", "Sprint" or any other caption.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the product labels (headers)

fields.description:
Hey guys, when you create a sprint on a board and try to view the Velocity Chart, it displays the following message:

"There are no available sprints for this board."

It turns out the Velocity Chart is only available for Complete Sprints, and that's not documented:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Viewing+the+Velocity+Chart

Thanks!
Clarissa
fields.summary: Edit the Velocity Chart Documentation

fields.description:
Currently, users will only need to have project administration role on the projects to be able to start sprint. It does not need other condition.

However, there are cases that user would only want certain status to be achieved before a sprint can be started. 

For example refer to the screenshot below:
!startsprint.png!

So as a recommendation, to imply some condition before the sprint can be started.
fields.summary: Fulfill Certain Condition before Sprint can be Started

fields.description:
Currently, there are no status indication on the Backlog and the Sprint column, it is only available from the detailed view. User would need to click every single issue to check the status and it would be a hassle for a large instance.

So recommendation is to have the status included in the issue backlog and sprint, shown below:
!status.png!
fields.summary: Add Issue Status information to Issues Sprint and Backlog

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a JIRA and Confluence Applink (including the project and space mapping)
# Configure the external gadget in Confluence to accept _Agile Gadget_
# Add an Agile Gadget in the Confluence Space
# Change the Start or End Date
!date.png!
# Refresh the Confluence Page and the modification of the date changed to the default value
!refresh.png!

h4. Note
The same "Agile Gadget" in JIRA saved the latest changes.  Ie. If a user changed the start date, the same start date will be saved upon refreshing the dashboard
fields.summary: Agile Gadget in Confluence does follow the start/end date Configuration
Greenhopper looks bad on long projects names.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-8075].
  {panel}

According to ISO 8601 and NEN 2772 the week that starts on monday the 16th of august should be week 33 this year.
Greenhopper states this is week 32.

Therefore the bug is: week numbers are wrong

This is a problem for me because: It makes it hard to communicate about week numbers when different tools use different week numbers. Outlook 2010 does it right, why can't we? ;)

There may be more than one week standard out there that people want to use. Perhaps there is a good reason that Jira is currently not using the standards I mentioned. In that case this is not a bug but a feature request. In that case: please add a way for admins to choose the week numbering standard that they wish to follow.

to reproduce:
log in with admin rights for atleast one project
go to a project which you have rights for
click 'administer project'
click 'manage versions'
click the calendar for the 'release date'
compare week numbering with outlook 2010 and/or ISO 8601 and NEN 2772 numbering
fields.summary: week numbers in greenhopper are wrong

fields.description: [~jrogers] - we need to see what colouring we will use
fields.summary: Figure out the extract trend colours

fields.description: sprint ends today. now 3pm GMS +11, changed to GMT -9, should show 1 day, not 0
fields.summary: I change the user timezone, yet the days remaining stayed the same

fields.description: Are we rendering twice, with the first time a remaining of 0?
fields.summary: Weird rendering of a red 0 before the actual number

fields.description:

When attempting to save a new or edited Context in the Classic Boards, a NPE is thrown with the below stack trace.

h3. Environment

* JIRA 5.2.8
* PostgreSQL 9.1
* Max OS X 10.7.5

Create or edit an existing context and save the changes.

h3. Expected Results

The context is successfully saved.

h3. Notes

As this has been raised as a critical, do we have any workarounds? Additionally, this has presented in both OnDemand and BTF.
fields.summary: Can't save, edit or create contexts in GreenHopper Classic Boards

fields.description: check with burndown gadget, same logic as there
fields.summary: only sprints which aren't complete should be selectable
Only scrum boards should be selectable

fields.description:
Root problem:
The only way epics currently disappear in plan mode is by marking them as "Done" (Epic Status field). If a user closes an epic using workflow transitions beforehand though, the epic is made read-only, so marking an epic as "Done" after that will fail.

Why we are where we are:
When we originally discussed how we wanted to mark epics as done, we decided to use a separate field so we we wouldn't have to handle workflows. A separate field gets around all these problems, so was a good solution for the problem. In case of the workflow option we would most likely have looked at the resolution field only. If there is a value => epic is done, if it is empty => epic isn't done yet. We could have set that field instead, but it would have been unclear which resolution to choose from, plus it possibly would have made the issue inconsistent with the workflow configured for it.

Proposed change:
I still believe using epic status is a good solution, but we could improve the current functionality by *also* applying the logic mentioned above. So, if EITHER the epic status is "Done" OR the epic has a resolution then we regard an epic as done. Had we implemented this logic upfront we could even have gotten around the upgrade task that tried filling in epic status values for already resolved issues :)
fields.summary: As a user I also want the resolution field to be used to mark an Epic as Done

fields.description: User wants a chart that has distinctions between issues/items present when the sprint was initially created versus things added later on.
fields.summary: Customer would like a chart that differentiates between older/newer sprints

This request is mostly releated to preserving historical data, and to be able to analyze all historical data in one place. As I understand it, classic boards will be removed, and this results in loss of historical data. It would also be nice to be able to remove these virtual versions from the version list with all the data migrated to the new boards.

fields.description:
GreenHopper is designed to return the results of a board's JQL filter as "the backlog".  This often results in very large backlogs on a board.  Users have the option of reducing board scope by using labels and/or clever filtering, but this is not the same as thinking of a backlog as a human-managed list, rather than the managing the results of a query.  

The point is to be able to see both the "potential backlog" and "backlog" stories, but hide the potential backlog most of the time.
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want to groom my backlog, not have it be the results of JQL
Incorporate into Create Version dialog
Database level work

fields.description: When making comments on tickets from the Rapid board, the comment screen blocks a majority of the view on the board. It'd be useful to have the comment screen in-line in the details view or somewhere that doesn't block the cards to so it can quickly be referenced.
fields.summary: Comment box blocks card view in Rapid Board

fields.description:
This is my case: one project, multiple teams each with a board. Each team is taking one or more epics from the product backlog to their team's backlog to work on. Component field is in use to specify part of a product that is affected - e.g. I can't use it for greenhopper stuff. I also get bugs from support that i want to assign to a specific team/board that are not linked with a specific epic.

Requirements
1) Assign an epic or an issue to a team/board?
2) Create a board filter that takes team's epics, issues, their related stories and their related sub-tasks

I'm currently setting a label "team1" to mark an epic or defect is under team-1's board. I then use a board filter that looks like this:

labels = 'team1' OR issue in (linkedIssuesFromQuery("labels = 'team1'"), 
subtaskIssuesFromQuery("issue in linkedIssuesFromQuery(\"labels = 'team1'\")"))"

For the extra functions I use the Craftforge JQL Functions Plugin. The problems I have are: (1) I get all sorts of linked issues here that are not related to the epic (relates to, clones, duplicates). (2) It's too complicated!
fields.summary: Allow user to assign an epic/issue to a specific team/board and see all of it's respsctive issues and subtasks in that board

fields.description: Currently, using the Epic Link column only shows the epic's issue key.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to see the Epic Name as a column in Issue Navigator searches
ADG GH: Report mode scrolling and header re-org

fields.description:
We have some issues today with our GH managed fields.

# Some of our fields have duplicates created
# Some of our fields have multiple contexts when there should only be one

The number of already affected customers is large enough to warrant writing an upgrade task. We hope that this problem will not occur in the future, thanks to fixes implemented in GHS-7984.

The task will need to:
* remove duplicate fields/contexts
* merge data from multiple fields/contexts into one field
* ensure that the "managed" field from GH's perspective refers to the correct field

The fields that currently cause trouble are
- Epic Name
- Epic Status
- Sprint

Both fields will have to have their values merged into the field the upgrade task choses to be the "default field" (which needs to be correctly set in the properties too).

(!) Test Brainstorming (!)
 - claim the default field as default still

SPRINT
- find all fields by name
- merge data = take default value if you can, or latest duplicate field value if you can't
- rename duplicate fields to obsolete and don't delete
- fix up field configurations
- relock?
- set reindex message

EPIC NAME
- similar to sprint

EPIC STATUS
- fetch fields by name
- resolve name to ID and use that everywhere
- merge values
- fix up field configurations
fields.summary: Create an upgrade task which fixes errant field configurations for GH managed fields

fields.description: Timebox this to 1 personday

fields.description:
We experience strange behaviour that issues disappear after about 10-15 seconds from both the Greenhopper Epic and the Structure plugin.

Scenario 1: In Greenhopper, drag an issue from the backlog into an Epic or create an issue from the Epic directly. The Epic field is correctly presented on the issue, but this disappears after 10-15 seconds. Epic field in the issue gets cleared.

Scenario 2: Add an issue to a structure page using Add to Structure on the issue main page. The issue is shown on the Structure page, but disappears from the page after about 10-15 seconds. The issue is not linked to the Structure page anymore.

Versions:

•JIRA 5.1.3 (issue also confirmed in later versions)
•Greenhopper plugin 6.1.4.2 (latest)
•Structure plugin 2.1.4 (latest)

Seems this is not related to the plugins, but to JIRA. I've also created a ticket with the Structure support team.
fields.summary: Issues disappear from Epic in Greenhopper and in Structure

fields.description: You are able to retrieve a list of stories from an epic, but the inverse is not possible. Would like to see a way to provide a list of issues and return a list of epics that across them
fields.summary: Get a list of Epics given a list of stories

fields.description:
I have a business critical need to add parent/child hierarchy to JIRA, the 2-3 level thing *does not* cut it, it simply has no chance of address teams that work with many release streams over many teams. Basically its not supportive of enterprise work.

We looked at the Structure plugin...its useless, yes you can make it work for a hierarchy of issues, but you have to use it in such a convoluted way, that there is no point.

So, we're adding the ability to "split" items recursively (a new issue type Split Child with appropriate links and plugins to support that).

That's all good, works fine, but, when it comes to showing the parent/child structure on the rapid board...blam! no hierarchy.

Ok, so on the left side of the rapid board we can see that Epic is used to "scope" what is seen on the right side.  

This suggests a natural "navigator" context, great...is there any chance that we improve Greenhopper and allow us to add another row to the left side where instead of Epic it would show our Parent/Child tree?  

A hierarchy navigator would only require that we (the admins) can  configure the hierarchy navigator with an issue link type(s) so that it would know how to build a tree, on a given issue.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to be able to configure a hierarchy navigator with an issue type(s) so that it would know how to build a tree, on a given issue

fields.description:
If we open planning board in jira and click on the link "view in issue navigator" kickass-navigtor is shown instead of the classical navigator. 
This experimental navigator doesnt work fine (e.g. sorting problems, filtering), so we want deactivate it.
If we click on the link "back to classical navigator" we expect that the new navigator is disabled. Next time we start the planning board and viewing the issues, kickass starts again.

# Click on the 'View on issue Navigator' tab, then it will direct you to the issue navigator and shows up all the related issues as on the board. 

Some screenshot might help:

!navigator.JPG|thumbnail!

The GreenHopper days remaining gadget is very useful, but why is it so freaking huge? Please provide a smaller version - something like 100 pixels high.

I understand that you think you have done this on purpose for horizontal alignment reasons, but I don't care. The problem is height - when my dashboard contains a chart or a filter Results gadget I need wide columns, but sitting at the top of the column is the greenhopper-days-remaining consuming fully 1/3 of the vertical screen real-estate. I want the information. I want it to be visible, I just don't want it to use up that much height.

It's almost impossible to align gadgets left-to-right anyway. The spacer is useless, and without something like a multi-column horizontal line it's just too frustrating to try to keep items aligned, so efficient space usage is much, much more important than alignment.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-8029].
  {panel}

When a sprint is started with a delay (set with a time in the future), issues that are removed from it before it starts in fact are shown as "Issues not Completed" on the Sprint Report. The expected behavior would be to have them show up in the "Removed from Sprint" section, or don't show up at all.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new sprint from a board, add some issues to it.
# Start that sprint with a delay. For instance, set start date for the next day.
# Remove a few issues from it.
# Check Sprint report, you can still see the issues removed from it in the "Issues Not Completed" section. One would expect them to disappear from the report, or at least show in the "Issues Removed from Sprint" section. On the other hand, Burndown Chart will only start burning data when the sprint starts in fact (the next day).
# End the sprint. Issues are still shown there regardless.
fields.summary: Sprint Report shows issues that were removed from the sprint in the "Issues Not Completed" section

Since we log time for Capitalization purposes, doing time estimates isn't a good option. We moved to just doing a burndown on issue count. Unfortunately, this isn't supported. fields.description:
In our company we use one Agile Board to manage more than one project. Until now we had to use Quick Filters to filter all visible issues for e.g. a single project or a single version.
Those Quick Filters do never apply to Epics, which is not very user friendly, because when I filter for a single project or a single version, I don't care about unaffected Epics. Having to pin a single Epic in a haystack of Epics is nearly unusable.

The same goes for Versions (still via Labs). When I select a version, I wish all Epics to be filtered for this selected version. Also as long as I have to filter for a specific project via Quick Filters, I wish those filters to apply on Epics and Versions as well.
fields.summary: Apply Quick Filters to Epics (and Versions)

The board should not allow to exceed the limit (i.e. story points) or at least visually signal that I exceed it while adding new stories to the sprint.

Hello,

also, the new selection-color (light-grey?) when selecting an epic in the epics panel is so light that you hardly see what epis is selected. please revert back to green or something else that springs to the eye a bit better

fields.description:
As Patrick, I want to be able to edit startDate for a fixVersion in JIRA so that the experience between GH and JIRA is consistent and not confusing.

h4. Approach for JIRA 6.0

JIRA code base:
* Modify JIRA's {{version}} table to include a start date column
* Make the above schema change on JIRA 5.2.x branch so that downgrades continue to work.
* Augment the RESTful table in JIRA's Project Admin page for Versions to show this start date and allow editing of it
* Augment the REST representation of versions to include start date
* Add the start date field to the JIRA API for a Version object

GH code base:
* Make GH aware of the capability of storing start date in either JIRA or GH, depending on the JIRA version.
* Migrate data stored in GH for start date to JIRA storage if available.

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: How will adding a startDate to a previously released version affect the issues that apply to it?
A: (/) If a previously released version has a release date, the new start date will be validated against the release date.

Q: How will adding a startDate affect issues that have been Archived?
A: (/) Changes to version data do not affect issues.

Q: Which timezone setting will the startDate follow, user's or system's?
A: (/) Start date and release date are both stored in the JVM system time zone.

Q: Can you remove the startDate after adding it?
A: (/) Yes.

Q: What is one way to get the startDate to come after the releaseDate?
A: (/) Not possible.

Q: What happens when you add a startDate to a version that has been released but has no releaseDate?
A: (/) Start date can be added without release date.

Q: Is there a special place in the database this column/row will go? Depending on the database used, is there a way for this location to be already taken, and/or do we recycle a location/field ID? We need to protect against overwrites.
A: (/) The field {{startdate}} did not exist in the table {{projectversion}} before now.

Q: How is the data synchronised between GH AO tables and JIRA?
A: (/) When the Version meta data is asked for in GH, it will check to see if it exists in JIRA as well. If so, it will be migrated over.
fields.summary: Edit startDate of a fixVersion in JIRA

fields.description:
Currently in order to retrieve all the issues in the sprint via JQL I need to know the id of the sprint. The id of the current sprint changes each time the new sprint starts meaning I need to change my JQL expression. 
I want to have be able to write a JQL that would always return issues from the current sprint.

I know that in general there could be more than one current sprint. I don't mind if JQL returns issues for all current sprints in such case. I always have only one sprint going and I expect most people would.
fields.summary: I want to be able to have a JQL query that would return issues in the current sprint without specifying sprint id

The filter in top left of my planning tab on the Agile Greenhopper board used to filter the items in my backlog to tickets that contained the word I am searching.
This stopped working when the 5.2 search upgrade was deployed today.

Backlogs are long and this feature was something I used a lot to find a ticket in the ranked backlog- please fix the bug.
